alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 12:06PM MST until September 13 at 12:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 100 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1204 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms continues to fall over the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Little Chino Valley, Granite Creek, Hell Canyon, Verde River, Williamson Valley Wash and Big Chino Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chino Valley and Paulden. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 329 and 345. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
